body.p: Twenty-third governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. Cumberland County, Kentucky, native. Married Sallie Travis Bramlette in 1843. Father of James T. Bramlette. Practiced law in Clinton County, Kentucky, and Columbia, Kentucky. Represented Cumberland and Clinton Counties in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1841 to 1843. Commonwealth's Attorney of the Eighth Judicial District of Kentucky from 1848 to 1850. Circuit Judge of the Sixth Judicial District of Kentucky from 1856 to 1861. Colonel of the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment, U. S. A. from 1861 to 1862. District Attorney of the United States District Court for Kentucky in 1863. Elected governor of Kentucky in November 1863 over Charles A. Wickliffe. Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from September 1, 1863, to September 3, 1863. Owned law firm of Bramlette & Van Winkle in partnership with Ephraim L. Van Winkle.

bibl.p: Ross A. Webb, “Thomas E. Bramlette (1863-1867)” in Lowell H. Harrison, ed., Kentucky’s Governors (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2004), 93-97; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, The Town of Columbia 1st Division, p. 13.
